tape_source.implementation: Homepage script array rendered into tape DOM; not sourced from frameworks.json or a dedicated endpoint.
evidence: Live page contains hardcoded update records in script block (e.g. Feb 10-14 entries).
No public /api/daily-signals endpoint detected on live site during crawl.

data_sync_status.summary: frameworks.json is internally structured and timestamped, but source alignment to AGENTS_2026_SOURCES.md is incomplete.
checks: framework evidence URLs are a smaller subset and include URL variants not matching markdown catalog exactly.

confidence_integrity.summary: Confidence labels are present at index and dimension levels, but one-to-one confidence-to-source traceability is not consistently enforced at claim granularity.
checks: AMI/ARI/EPI confidence labels present in frameworks.json.
Not every confidence label maps to a normalized source ID list in the public payload.

automation_status.summary: Daily signals appear manually embedded in frontend code and updated by deployment, not via automated ingestion pipeline.

issues.description: Live tape is hardcoded; no API-backed feed or timestamped ingestion process.
issues.impact: Limits update cadence and creates stale-signal risk.

issues.description: No normalized source ID model shared across frameworks.json, tape updates, and report claims.
issues.impact: Confidence labels are harder to audit and automate.

issues.description: Evidence URLs in frameworks.json do not fully align with AGENTS_2026_SOURCES.md source inventory.
issues.impact: Potential citation drift and mismatch across surfaces.

issues.description: robots/sitemap responses from live crawl were inconsistent and returned not-found in probe attempts.
Homepage signals are month-scoped and edition-weighted, with weak daily freshness cues.

weekly_briefs.title: Weekly Brief 1: Security Patches vs Exposure Drag
weekly_briefs.subtitle: Coverage window: 2026-02-09 to 2026-02-15
executive_delta_summary: OpenClaw EPI increased on foundation transition evidence.
OpenClaw ARI also increased due to unresolved exposure findings.
CrewAI ARI improved after sandbox hardening release.
LangChain ARI improved after reported tool-injection patch.
MCP ecosystem EPI rose on continued endpoint adoption growth.

weekly_briefs.title: Weekly Brief 2: Benchmark Leadership and Risk Disclosure
weekly_briefs.subtitle: Coverage window: 2026-02-02 to 2026-02-08
executive_delta_summary: Claude Opus 4.6 benchmark evidence strengthened Anthropic maturity positioning.
SecurityScorecard exposure findings added material downside to OpenClaw risk posture.
Kaspersky audit introduced high-severity risk confirmation in the open-agent tier.
MCP standard momentum continued as a cross-vendor alignment signal.
No methodology change occurred during the week.

weekly_briefs.title: Weekly Brief 3: Framework Distribution and Adoption Signals
weekly_briefs.subtitle: Coverage window: 2026-01-26 to 2026-02-01
executive_delta_summary: OpenClaw community acceleration remained the strongest ecosystem signal.
MCP alignment strengthened cross-framework interoperability narratives.
n8n retained adoption momentum in enterprise automation workflows.
LangChain and CrewAI maintained security hardening trajectories.
No speculative-only deltas were applied this week.

homepage_integration_plan.objective: Replace hardcoded tape with API-fed signals and add latest weekly brief module below hero.

changes.description: Replace static tape array with GET /api/daily-signals?limit=7
changes.fallback: render last-known hardcoded message + link to /daily-signals

changes.description: Insert Latest Weekly Brief card below hero

details: Horizontal swipe tape container (overflow-x: auto; scroll-snap)
Tap-to-expand headline into compact detail drawer
